info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 5:04PM EDT until August 24 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Hart County in northeastern Georgia... Southwestern Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Southwestern Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 503 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hartwell, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Elberton, Hartwell, Calhoun Falls, Reed Creek, Bowman, Lowndesville, Russell State Park, Middleton, Bobby Brown State Park and Lake Strom Thurmond. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
